sen.j: 稲葉 正恒（いなば まさつね、宝永3年（1706年） - 享保15年3月24日 (旧暦)（1730年5月10日））は、山城国淀藩の第3代藩主。
sen.e: Masatsune INABA (1706 - May 10, 1730) was the third lord of Yodo domain of the Yamashiro Province.
Masatsune INABA (1706 - May 10, 1730) was the third lord of Yodo Domain of the Yamashiro Province.
sen.cmt: Domain大文字に訂正しました。
sen.e: Masatsune INABA (1706 - May 10, 1730) was the third lord of Yodo Domain of the Yamashiro Province.
He was the seventh grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari
He was the seventh grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。
sen.e: He was the seventh grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari.

sen.j: 淀藩稲葉家分家の7000石の大身旗本である稲葉正倚（稲葉正則の次男）の三男。
sen.e: He was the third son of Masayori INABA (second son of Masanori INABA), 7000 koku taishin hatamoto (greater vassal) and a branch family of the Inaba family of Yodo Domain.
He was the third son of Masayori INABA (second son of Masanori INABA), 7000 koku taishin hatamoto (greater vassal) and a branch family of the Inaba family of Yodo Domain.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: He was the third son of Masayori INABA (second son of Masanori INABA), 7000 koku taishin hatamoto (greater vassal) and a branch family of the Inaba family of Yodo Domain.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Mototsugu Mori.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Mototsugu MORI.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Mototsugu MORI.
His rank is unknown.
His rank is unknown.
His rank is unknown.
His common name was Heizaemon.
His common name was Heizaemon.
His common name was Heizaemon.

sen.j: 1714年、実父の死去により7000石の家督を継ぐ。
sen.e: He took over the family of 7000 koku in 1714 when his natural father died.
He took over the family of 7000 koku in 1714 when his natural father died.
He took over the family of 7000 koku in 1714 when his natural father died.

sen.j: 1730年正月12日に本家の先代藩主・稲葉正任が早世したため、その後を継いだが、後を追うように同年3月24日に25歳で死去してしまった。
sen.e: In January 12, 1730, the late lord of the domain Masato INABA who belonged to the head family died young, so he succeeded him, but he also died on March 24 of the same year at age 25 as if he had followed Masato.

In February 28, 1730, the late lord of the domain Masato INABA who belonged to the head family died young, so he succeeded him, but he also died on May 10 of the same year at age 25 as if he had followed Masato.
sen.cmt: 日付は前出の記載より旧暦と考えられますので、新暦に訂正しました。
sen.e: In February 28, 1730, the late lord of the domain Masato INABA who belonged to the head family died young, so he succeeded him, but he also died on May 10 of the same year at age 25 as if he had followed Masato.

sen.j: 家督は叔父の稲葉正直の家督2000石を継いでいた稲葉正親が承継した。
sen.e: The family estate was inherited by Masachika INABA who had inherited 2000 koku from his uncle Masanao INABA.
The family estate was inherited by Masachika INABA who had inherited 2000 koku from his uncle Masanao INABA.
The family estate was inherited by Masachika INABA who had inherited 2000 koku from his uncle Masanao INABA.
Hogo (a Buddhist name): Gosetsuin
Hogo (a Buddhist name): Gosetsuin
Hogo (a Buddhist name): Gosetsuin

sen.j: 墓所：東京都墨田区向島の弘福寺。
sen.e: Grave: Gufuku-ji Temple in Mukojima, Sumida Ward, Tokyo.
Grave: Kofuku-ji Temple in Mukojima, Sumida Ward, Tokyo.
Grave: Kofuku-ji Temple in Mukojima, Sumida Ward, Tokyo.
